title: Add configurable social media links to the site footer

requirements.text: Update the site footer social icons so they link to configurable social media URLs instead of using placeholder href="#" links.

quotes: How can i add my social media links to the footer?

acceptanceCriteria: The Facebook/X/Instagram/LinkedIn icons in the footer link to real URLs (not "#").
Each social link opens in a new tab and uses rel="noopener noreferrer".
Each icon link has an accessible label (e.g., aria-label) describing the destination social network.

requirements.text: Add a simple, code-based configuration point for footer social links (e.g., a single exported object/array in a new frontend config file) so non-developers can update social URLs by editing one place without touching the Footer component markup.

quotes: How can i add my social media links to the footer?

acceptanceCriteria: There is a single, clearly named config export (e.g., SOCIAL_LINKS) that contains the footer social URLs.
Footer.tsx reads social URLs from this config rather than hardcoding them inline.
If a social URL is empty/undefined, its icon is not rendered in the footer.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files in frontend/src/components/ui (compose them only).
Keep the existing footer phone number display ("Call us: 434-238-8796") unchanged.
nonGoals: Adding third-party social API integrations (e.g., fetching posts/feeds).
Adding backend persistence/admin UI for social links (this change should be achievable via frontend configuration only).
